title: Creating RIA sibling fail - Cannot determine special remote name
body:
#### What is the problem?

Hi :slightly_smiling_face:
After asking about the best Datalad practice [on neurostars](https://neurostars.org/t/datalad-beginner-compressed-sibling-yoda-and-singularity/18467/4), I've tried to setup a RIA store on our storage server through SSH.

Since neither Git nor Git Annex are installed on the remote, I use the `--storage-sibling=only` configuration.

To do so, I tried to use the following command:
```shell
datalad create-sibling-ria \
    --name=ceci \
    --storage-sibling=only \
    ria+ssh://martin@[HOST]:/home/ulg/crc/martin/riastore
```
The result is this error message:
```
[ERROR  ] initremote failed.
| stdout: initremote ceci 
| failed
| 
| stderr: git-annex: Cannot determine special remote name, got: ''
| git-annex: initremote: 1 failed
|  [create-sibling-ria(/media/martin/hdd/scratch/ria_test)] 
create-sibling-ria(error): /media/martin/hdd/scratch/ria_test (dataset) [initremote failed.
stdout: initremote ceci 
failed

stderr: git-annex: Cannot determine special remote name, got: ''
git-annex: initremote: 1 failed
]
```
And on the remote, it produced this folder structure:
```
riastore
├── b1a
│   └── a4d59-a304-47a1-9835-bf6aa79f5458
│       ├── annex
│       │   └── objects
│       ├── archives
│       └── ria-layout-version
├── error_logs
└── ria-layout-version
```

Do you have any clue about what is causing this error?

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```shell
datalad create my_dataset
cd my_dataset
datalad create-sibling-ria \
    --name=ceci \
    --storage-sibling=only \
    ria+ssh://[USER]@[HOST]:[PATH]
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

- OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- Python: 3.8.5
- Datalad: 0.14.0

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before?

Creating Gitlab siblings and the basic local usage of Datalad work smoothly on the same machine/with the same config.
